description: information about plants that are food

command.prompt:
Generate one row for a table of information about plants that are food. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes for the table is:
Plant;Variety;Color;Fruit;Soil;Water;Temperature;Light;Pruning;Fertilizer;Pest

Do not generate fictional rows. Generate the rows from real known data. Here is a list of semi-colon-separated rows not to generate by semantic key only:
Plant;Variety
Apple;Granny Smith
Basil, Sweet;Summer
Broccoli;Spring
Cabbage;Fall
Pear;Bartlett
Cherry;Rainier
Raspberry;Bountiful
Peach;August Pride
Watermelon;Crimson Sweet
Grape;Concord
Strawberry;Temptation
Radish;Cherry Belle
Eggplant;Neon
Cucumber;Lemon
Squash;Acorn
Asparagus;Jersey Knight
Tomato;Beefsteak
Lettuce;Romaine
Spinach;Space
Blueberry;Northcountry
Carrot;Danvers 126
Corn;Silver Queen

Output the row in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file with a column header. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.epilogue:
The new data is from the Lacinato variety of the Kale plant. Kale is a leafy green vegetable that can be grown in the fall. It prefers well-drained soil and requires frequent watering. The ideal temperature for growing Kale is cool. It can be grown in partial shade and benefits from light pruning. Compost is a good fertilizer for Kale. Common pests for Kale include aphids and whiteflies.

Sources:
1. "How to Grow Kale." The Spruce, www.thespruce.com/how-to-grow-kale-2539861.
2. "Kale, Lacinato." Rozendals Farm, www.rozendalsfarm.com/plants/kale-lacinato/.
3. "Lacinato Kale." Burpee, www.burpee.com/vegetables/kale/lacinato-kale-seeds-p52430025.
4. "Kale, Lacinato." Johnny's Selected Seeds, www.johnnyseeds.com/vegetables/kale/kale-lacinato-1115.html.
